instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .

threads.title: Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Hi Everyone,

My retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> is not charging (but recognizes them fine), so I bought 2 new batteries and neither of those are charging either. Please let me know if you have any ideas, I am totally out :(

Not sure if it helps but the fan is also spinning in full (might be because the logic board is outside the case?). I am using a 80W charger that I use for my 15" larger mac.

* Board turns on and boots okay without the battery connected (someone told me to check that but don't think its relevant)
* Charger light is orange, not sure if it should be green
* <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.55V
* Pin 17/18 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> = 2.8Ohm
* Pin 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> = 20.3Ohm
* <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> without charger = 230mV
* <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> with charger = 2.15-2.17V pulsing
* <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> = 3.392V
* Resistance of 17,18,27,28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> to GND = OL


Thanks!
Rohit

threads.title: Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: Did you put in the special screw that hold the plastic cover over the main big screw that clamps down the battery connector? It bridges a connection on the board to enable the battery. If in doubt post a picture of the connected battery board.
